forumNotes.author: wildcaribou
forumNotes.content:
Hello Forum Experts,  

I have a ISO that was made with Winbuilder. I have it booting from a external Hard drive that supports Esata and USB 2.0. It's able to boot fine when connected to the eSata port. However, when I try to boot it using the USB ports on my laptop I get the dreaded "stop 7B BSOD". I tried updating the Sata drivers but I still get the same 7B BSOD. Weird how it boots fine from eSata but not from USB. Has anybody ran into this problem before?  

Thanks!

forumNotes.author: Sha0
forumNotes.content:
> I have a ISO that was made with Winbuilder. I have it booting from a external Hard drive that supports Esata and USB 2.0. It's able to boot fine when connected to the eSata port. However, when I try to boot it using the USB ports on my laptop I get the dreaded "stop 7B BSOD". I tried updating the Sata drivers but I still get the same 7B BSOD. Weird how it boots fine from eSata but not from USB. Has anybody ran into this problem before?  
It's not weird at all. **Microsoft Windows** will use **SATA** drivers for SATA and **USB** drivers for USB. Updating SATA drivers will not affect your results if you are booting from USB. I'd suggest creating **CriticalDeviceDatabase** entries for your USB hardware and finding out what USB drivers you need.  

Also, please specify what you are building with **WinBuilder** , including project name and operating system version.

forumNotes.author: wildcaribou
forumNotes.content: Thanks Sha0! I got it working by rebuilding Win7PE. I'm not sure what happen the first time around. I appreciate your reply.
